attacks.name: Bad News
attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, choose a number of cards there, without looking, until your opponent has 5 cards left. Have your opponent discard the cards you chose.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Dragon Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Power Pinchers
abilities.text: As long as Crawdaunt is your Active Pokémon, when any of your Active Pokémon does damage to the Defending Pokémon, the attack does 10 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Shower
attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Flygon.

attacks.name: Rock Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Trip
attacks.text: If Grumpig and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Chain of Events
abilities.text: As long as Minun is your Active Pokémon, whenever your other Active Pokémon, if any, attacks, you may use Cheer On after the first attack (you still need the necessary Energy to use Cheer On). You can't use Cheer On more than once in this way even if your other Active Pokémon has the Chain of Events Poké-Body.

attacks.name: Cheer On
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Minun).

attacks.name: Special Circuit
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If you choose Pokémon that has a Poké-Power or Poké-Body, this attack does 40 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Chain of Events
abilities.text: As long as Plusle is your Active Pokémon, whenever your other Active Pokémon, if any, attacks, you may use Cheer On after the first attack (you still need the necessary Energy to use Cheer On). You can't use Cheer On more than once in this way even if your other Active Pokémon has the Chain of Events Poké-Body.

attacks.name: Cheer On
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Plusle).

attacks.name: Extra Circuit
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If you choose Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Thick Skin
abilities.text: Roselia can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Speed Growth
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Dragon Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Salamence is your Active Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Salamence is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Salamence during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Wonder Guard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shedinja by your opponent's Evolved Pokémon and Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Damage Curse
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter, plus 1 more damage counter for each damage counter on Shedinja, on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Generation
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Scorching Smoke
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torkoal.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Healing Wave
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sand Guard
abilities.text: Whenever Flygon would be damaged by your opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 20.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Flygon.

attacks.name: Synchronized Search
attacks.text: If Girafarig and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, pick any 1 card from your deck and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Breaking Impact
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost to that Pokémon (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Magnetic Field
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have basic Energy cards in your discard pile, you may discard any 1 card from your hand. Then search for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't return the card you first discarded to your hand in this way. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magnetic Force
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon (including Magneton).

abilities.name: Loose Shell
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Touch
attacks.text: You may switch Ninjask with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, you may move any number of Grass Energy cards attached to Ninjask to the new Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Salamence is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Flame
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Salamence. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shelgon during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Pick On
attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, look at his or her hand. Choose a number of cards there until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand and have your opponent shuffle the cards you chose into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Power Count
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon and all of your opponent's Pokémon. If your Pokémon have less Energy than your opponent's, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Quick Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Spark
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Dragon Dew
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Energy Recall
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to Flaaffy.

attacks.name: Double Metal Ball
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backspin
attacks.text: After your attack, you may discard 1 Energy card attached to Forretress. If you do, switch Forretress with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Graveler.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: Does 80 damage to each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage. If not, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Dragon Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon. Discard an Energy card from each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Horsea.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sonic Wing
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Seadra during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Energy Guard
abilities.text: As long as Shelgon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, damage done to Shelgon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: Damage done to Shelgon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Attack
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If Vibrava has any basic Energy cards attached to it, Vibrava's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Whiscash is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Whiscash by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Risky Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Dragon Eye
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Grip
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pebble Throw
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Spurt
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy card attached to Grimer. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for Magikarp and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Mudkip but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Nincada the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. If Nincada has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Numel and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Pineco by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Luring Flame
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stifling Fluff
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for Grass Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Balloon Berry
rules: When the Pokémon Balloon Berry is attached to retreats, discard Balloon Berry instead of discarding Energy cards.

name: Buffer Piece
rules: Damage done to the Pokémon Buffer Piece is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). At the end of your opponent's turn after you played Buffer Piece, discard Buffer Piece.

name: Energy Recycle System
rules: Choose 1:• Put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.• Shuffle 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: High Pressure System
rules: Each player pays Colorless less to retreat his or her Fire and Water Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Low Pressure System
rules: Each Grass and Lightning Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +10 HP.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Mr. Briney's Compassion
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play (excluding Pokémon-ex). Return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: TV Reporter
rules: Draw 3 cards. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

abilities.name: Conductivity
abilities.text: As long as Ampharos ex is in play, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card to his or her Pokémon from hand, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. You can't put more than 1 damage counter even if there is more than 1 Ampharos ex in play.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Call for Power
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Dragonite ex. This power can't be used if Dragonite ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dragon Wave
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy card and a Lightning Energy card attached to Dragonite ex.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Golem ex does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Genetic Memory
attacks.text: Use any attack from Kingdra ex's Basic Pokémon card or Stage 1 Evolution card. (Kingdra ex doesn't have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Kingdra ex but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mist Ball
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Latias ex.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios ex.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios ex.

attacks.name: Melting Mountain
attacks.text: Discard the top card from your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to Magcargo ex.

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of basic Energy cards attached to Magcargo ex when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card you discarded.

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: As long as Muk ex is your Active Pokémon, ignore all Poké-Powers and Poké-Bodies other than Toxic Gas.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Slimy Water
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

attacks.name: Spiral Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza ex.

attacks.name: Dragon Burst
attacks.text: Discard either all Fire Energy or all Lightning Energy attached to Rayquaza ex. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fire or Lightning Energy discarded.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Charmander.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to Charizard (1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Flame Pillar
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy card attached to Charizard. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and do 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
